definition: to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

pinyin: chi2 bu4 tong2 zheng4 jian4 zhe3

sentences.english: On the U. S. -Japan relationship, Japanese politics are in disarray.
sentences.chinese: 在美日關係上，日本政見十分混亂。

sentences.english: Left-wing dissidents have been emasculated and marginalised.
sentences.chinese: 左派持不同政見者已經遭到削弱和排擠。

sentences.english: In retaliation, the Whigs expelled Tyler from their party.
sentences.chinese: 由於政見的牴觸，泰勒被輝格黨開除出黨。

sentences.english: Mr Thein Sein has also appealed to exiled dissidents to come home.
sentences.chinese: 登盛先生也呼籲持不同政見的流亡者返回家園。

sentences.english: Did he know M. Fauchelevent's opinions?
sentences.chinese: 他知道割風先生的政見嗎？

sentences.english: Dumas kept the Republican political views, against the monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 大仲馬信守共和政見，反對君主專政。

sentences.english: He also oversaw the release of thousands of political prisoners and dissidents.
sentences.chinese: 他還監督政治犯和釋放數千名持不同政見者。

sentences.english: Since then, the repression of dissidents has been stepped up.
sentences.chinese: 自打那以後，持不同政見者遭到了鎮壓。

sentences.english: China's prisons are littered with high profile dissidents.
sentences.chinese: 中國監獄到處是高調的持不同政見者。

sentences.english: China shoots and kills every single anti-national, terrorist, or dissident at gun point.
sentences.chinese: 中國開槍打死反國家人士，恐怖分子或持不同政見者。

sentences.english: And in your house, politics divide.
The first is a dissident coalition of conservative Peronists.
sentences.chinese: 首先是保守派貝隆主義者中一個持不同政見的聯盟。

sentences.english: Bush will also meet with several Burmese dissidents while in Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 布什總統在訪泰期間還將會見幾名緬甸持不同政見者。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen was a prominent dissident who had been exiled from China.
sentences.chinese: 孫文是從中國流亡的一位著名不同政見者。

sentences.english: On the U.S.-Japan relationship, Japanese politics are in disarray.
sentences.chinese: 在美日關係上，日本政見十分混亂。

definition: to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
to speak bluntly (idiom)/not to mince words
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
